kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using `dbName`, `dbUsername`, and `dbPassword`.
kw.msg: Connecting using : pymssql.connect(database=TRN, user=TestLogin, password=1234, host=192.168.1.6, port=1433)

test.name: Prerequisite №1. Check that 3 tables (jobs, locations, employees) exist

kw.name: Table Must Exist
kw.doc: Check if the table given exists in the database. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Table Must Exist | jobs
Executing : Row Count | SELECT * FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_name='jobs'

kw.name: Table Must Exist
kw.doc: Check if the table given exists in the database. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Table Must Exist | locations
Executing : Row Count | SELECT * FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_name='locations'

kw.name: Table Must Exist
kw.doc: Check if the table given exists in the database. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Table Must Exist | employees
Executing : Row Count | SELECT * FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_name='employees'

test.name: Prerequisite №2. Check that 3 tables (jobs, locations, employees) are not empty

kw.name: Row Count Is Greater Than X
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is greater than the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Greater Than X | select * from hr.jobs | 0
Executing : Row Count | select * from hr.jobs

kw.name: Row Count Is Greater Than X
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is greater than the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Greater Than X | select * from hr.locations | 0

kw.name: Row Count Is Greater Than X
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is greater than the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Greater Than X | select * from hr.employees | 0

test.name: TC №1. Check that table "Jobs" has 4 columns

kw.name: Row Count Is Equal To X
kw.arg: select distinct column_name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name = 'Jobs'
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is equal to the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Equal To X | select distinct column_name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name = 'Jobs' | 4
Executing : Row Count | select distinct column_name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name = 'Jobs'

test.name: TC №2. Check that table "Jobs" has record where job_title is 'Programmer'

kw.name: Check If Exists In Database
kw.arg: select job_title from hr.jobs where job_title = 'Programmer'
kw.doc: Check if any row would be returned by given the input `selectStatement`. If there are no results, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Check If Exists In Database | select job_title from hr.jobs where job_title = 'Programmer'
Executing : Query | select job_title from hr.jobs where job_title = 'Programmer'

test.name: TC №3. Check that table "Locations" has column 'postal_code'

kw.name: Check If Exists In Database
kw.arg: select column_name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name = 'Locations' and Column_name = 'postal_code'
kw.doc: Check if any row would be returned by given the input `selectStatement`. If there are no results, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Check If Exists In Database | select column_name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name = 'Locations' and Column_name = 'postal_code'
Executing : Query | select column_name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name = 'Locations' and Column_name = 'postal_code'

test.name: TC №4. Check that table "Locations" doesn't contain duplicates by field "street_address"

kw.name: Row Count Is Equal To X
kw.arg: select street_address, count(*) from hr.locations group by street_address having count(*) > 1
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is equal to the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Equal To X | select street_address, count(*) from hr.locations group by street_address having count(*) > 1 | 0
Executing : Row Count | select street_address, count(*) from hr.locations group by street_address having count(*) > 1

test.name: TC №5. Calculate max, min and avg of salary from "Employees" table

kw.name: Query
kw.arg: select round(max(salary),2), round(min(salary),2), round(avg(salary),2) from hr.employees
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.
kw.msg: Executing : Query | select round(max(salary),2), round(min(salary),2), round(avg(salary),2) from hr.employees
${queryResults} = [(Decimal('24000.00'), Decimal('0.00'), Decimal('7885.000000'))]

kw.name: Log
kw.arg: Max salary is ${queryResults[0][0]}, mix salary is ${queryResults[0][1]} and avarage salary is ${queryResults[0][2]} among employees
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.
kw.msg: Max salary is 24000.00, mix salary is 0.00 and avarage salary is 7885.000000 among employees

test.name: TC №6. Check that column "Email" doesn't contain NULLs in "Employees" table

kw.name: Row Count Is Equal To X
kw.arg: select * from hr.employees where email is null
kw.doc: Check if the number of rows returned from `selectStatement` is equal to the value submitted. If not, then this will throw an AssertionError. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Row Count Is Equal To X | select * from hr.employees where email is null | 0
Executing : Row Count | select * from hr.employees where email is null
